newsitem.title: RUSSIA: St Petersburg Telephone to auction shares.
newsitem.headline: St Petersburg Telephone to auction shares.

text.p: Russia's St Petersburg Telephone will hold a special cash auction for 1.2 percent of its shares on October 9, the city property fund said.
The 186,594 shares with a nominal value of 50 roubles each will be on offer at a starting price of 50,000 roubles each.
There are no restrictions on who may participate.

Shareholders decided in April to raise the company's charter capital 600-fold by increasing the nominal value of a share to 30,000 roubles, followed by a split to make the nominal value 1,000 roubles.
However, a company official said the new charter capital had not yet been registered with the city authorities so the old 50-rouble nominal value would apply in the auction.
AO Peterburgskaya Telefonnaya Syet's main shareholder is the AO Svyazinvest holding company, with 41.8 percent of the ordinary shares.
The company's shares were $1 higher at $17.20 at 0815 GMT on the Russian Trading System.
